wp:term.wp:term_description: American cuisine consists of the cooking style and traditional dishes prepared in the United States. It has been significantly influenced by Europeans, indigenous Native Americans, Africans, Asians, Pacific Islanders, and many other cultures and traditions.
Appetizers are small dishes served before a meal to stimulate appetite. They can be simple or elaborate and are often served at social gatherings or in restaurants.
Asian recipes can be vegetarian or meat-based, and can be prepared in a variety of cooking methods, including stir-frying, grilling, and steaming.
Baking requires precise measurements and timing, and often involves mixing ingredients together, shaping them into a desired form, and placing them in a preheated oven.
Beverages are drinks consumed for refreshment or enjoyment. They can be hot or cold and made from a variety of ingredients, including fruits, grains, and herbs
Breakfast is often seen as an important meal because it provides energy and nutrients to start the day. It can be a quick and simple meal, or a more elaborate spread.

Broiling is a cooking method that involves using direct radiant heat to cook food. It is often used to sear or brown the surface of meats, fish, and vegetables, and can be done in an oven or on a grill.
Chinese recipes can be vegetarian or meat-based, and are often characterized by their bold flavors and aromatic spices.
Delicious recipes are dishes that are pleasing to the taste and have a high level of flavor. They can be simple or complex, and can be made with a variety of ingredients and cooking techniques.
Desserts are often indulgent and can be made with a variety of ingredients, including sugar, chocolate, fruit, and cream.
Dinner is often a larger and more formal meal than lunch, and may be served with multiple courses, such as a starter, main dish, and dessert.
Grilling is a popular cooking method that can produce a wide range of flavors, from smoky and charred to sweet and caramelized.
Tasty recipes are dishes that are enjoyable to eat and have a high level of flavor. They can be made with a variety of ingredients and cooking techniques and can be simple or complex.

Indian recipes can be vegetarian or meat-based, and are often characterized by their aromatic spices and bold flavors. Indian cuisine is known for its wide range of regional specialties, including Punjabi, Tamil, and Bengali.

Italian recipes can be vegetarian or meat-based, and are often characterized by their fresh, simple ingredients and bold flavors. Italian cuisine is known for its wide range of regional specialties, including Tuscan, Sicilian, and Roman.
Lunch is often eaten at home, at work, or in a restaurant and can be a time to take a break from daily activities and refuel with nourishing food.

Mexican recipes can be vegetarian or meat-based, and are often characterized by their bold flavors and aromatic spices. Mexican cuisine is known for its wide range of regional specialties, including Yucatecan, Oaxacan, and Veracruzan.
Roasting requires precise timing and temperature control to ensure that the food is cooked to the desired level of doneness.
Sautéing is a quick and efficient way to cook food and can be used to create a variety of dishes, including stir-fries, pan-fried meats, and sautéed vegetables.
Simmering requires precise temperature control and timing to ensure that the food is cooked to the desired level of doneness.
South African cuisine reflects the diverse range of culinary traditions embodied by the various communities that inhabit the country.

Healthy Recipes are typically made with fresh, whole ingredients and can be low in calories, fat, and added sugars. Healthy recipes can be found in a variety of cuisines and can be vegetarian or meat-based.

Thai recipes are often characterized by their bold flavors and aromatic spices, and can be vegetarian or meat-based. Thai cuisine is known for its wide range of regional specialties, including Southern, Northern, and Central Thai.

Vegan diets are made up of only plant-based foods. This type of diet includes fruits, vegetables, soy, legumes, nuts and nut butters, plant-based dairy alternatives, sprouted or fermented plant foods and whole grains. Vegan diets don't include animal foods like eggs, dairy, meat, poultry or seafood

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: http://cookitup.great-site.net.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: The Best Instant Pot French Toast recipe (vegan & Gluten Free!)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Love French Toast Casserole, but don’t time to let it sit overnight? Not to worry, with this Instant PotFrench Toast will be ready in no time! Note – this may look like different pictures than what got you here. We were finding that readers were having issues with the recipe so we totally reworked it! Please give us your feedback in the comments. We welcome constructive comments that will help us serve you better!

Instant Pot French Toast Recipe

You may have made a cinnamon roll french toast casserole or french toast bake, but those can take a long time to make. With the instant pot craze going on, we thought we would try to shorten the preparation time needed for traditional french toast bakes! We love our instant pot and use it for dinners all the time. We have even used it for dessert with our Instant Pot Monkey Bread. The ease and quickness of it are perfect for our busy lifestyle. I honestly had no idea that you could even make french toast in the instant pot! But it is really easy!Feel free to add in some fun additions like pecans, walnuts or chocolate chips! They are all great. This will make the perfect dish for your Christmas Morning Brunch! Looking for some other great Christmas Morning Recipes? We have tons!!
item.excerpt:encoded: Love French Toast Casserole, but don’t time to let it sit overnight? Not to worry, with this Instant Pot French Toast will be ready in no time!

item.title: Baked delicious mozzarella chicken Burger

item.content:encoded: Bean salad is a common cold salad composed of various cooked beans – green beans, yellow wax beans, garbanzo beans, kidney beans – and typically fresh raw onions, peppers, and/or other vegetables, tossed in a vinaigrette or vinegar and characteristically sweetened with sugar. It can also be prepared as a pickled dish. Bean salad is a popular choice for home canning. Salads prepared with this method should be used within a year for best quality.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil (2 Tbsp salt for 2 quarts of water). Add the green beans to the water and blanch only for about 2 minutes or so, until the beans are just barely cooked through, but still crisp. Fresh young beans should cook quickly. Older, tougher beans may take longer. While the beans are cooking, prepare a large bowl of ice water. When the beans are ready, use a slotted spoon to remove them from the boiling water to the ice water to stop the cooking. Drain the green beans and the red onions.

item.title: Amagwinya
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Whether you call them amagwinya or vetkoek, there’s no denying that these fried treats are one of South Africa’s most treasured foods. Essentially a kind of doughnut, amagwinya is traditionally made with a yeasty bread dough that is shaped into balls (sometimes flattened slightly) before being fried in plenty of hot oil until golden brown and slightly swollen, with a soft, bread-like centre – heaven!
The traditional recipe using yeast gives you a light, airy vetkoek similar to a doughnut, but in a pinch, baking powder can be used. The dough can also be wrapped around a filling before you fry it.

Peel potatoes. Cut into long chips about 1.5cm thick. Use a clean tea towel or large piece of paper towel to pat potatoes dry.

";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:1;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:182:"

Pour vegetable oil into a large saucepan, wok or deep-fryer until it is half-full. Heat over medium-high heat until a small piece of potato skin sizzles when dropped into oil.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:2;a:7:{s:11:"instruction";s:321:"

Place a wire rack over a large oven tray lined with paper towels. Divide chips into 3 batches. Cook chips, 1 batch at a time, for 5 minutes or until they just start to colour. Use a slotted spoon to remove to rack. Repeat with remaining 2 batches, allowing oil to reheat in between batches. Preheat oven to 180°C.

item.title: Homemade Beef Stew
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: A homemade beef stew recipe for the stovetop. This traditional stew is good eaten from a bowl or poured over biscuits. Substitute lamb and voila!... Irish stew! If thicker stew is desired, add more cornstarch and/or take the cover off for the last 15 to 20 minutes. The longer this simmers, the better! Vary the herbs to your taste.

item.title: Boerewors Roll with Caramelised Onions
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Boerewors is based on an older traditional Dutch sausage called the verse worst, though it differs somewhat in its ingredients. In South Africa, Boerewors is as traditional as you can get and it is hard to imagine a sports event, farmer’s market or school fete without someone selling Boerewors Rolls aka "Worsbroodjies".

item.title: Bacon ‘n’ Egg Sandwiches
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: I came across this unique grilled combo when I was digging in my mom's recipe box. The crisp bacon, hard-boiled eggs and crunchy green onions make these cozy sandwiches look impressive when company drops by for lunch. Best of all, they're a snap to assemble. —Ann Fuemmeler, Glasgow, Missouri

"Delicious stovetop popcorn recipe! Perfectly crispy and addictive

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
a:68:{s:14:"recipeSubtitle";s:269:"Dumplings are the perfect addition to a casserole or stew, to me, the meal isn’t complete without them! Here’s my recipe for how to make dumplings without suet or very much effort! They’re simple, delicious and you only need flour, water and butter to make these.";s:17:"recipeDescription";s:313:"

Traditionally, dumplings are made with suet – but, suet isn’t an ingredient most people buy often (other than, if they’re making dumplings or suet pastry). I’m a big fan of making cooking as simple and straight forward as it can be – and not having to buy new or unnecessary ingredients to do so!

";s:14:"recipeKeywords";s:8:"dumpling";s:15:"difficultyLevel";s:12:"intermediate";s:8:"prepTime";s:2:"15";s:12:"prepTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:8:"cookTime";s:2:"25";s:12:"cookTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:11:"cookingTemp";s:3:"155";s:15:"cookingTempUnit";s:1:"C";s:8:"restTime";s:2:"25";s:12:"restTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:14:"recipeCalories";s:0:"";s:10:"bestSeason";s:9:"available";s:13:"estimatedCost";s:2:"45";s:17:"estimatedCostCurr";s:1:"R";s:12:"noOfServings";s:0:"";s:15:"ingredientTitle";s:0:"";s:17:"recipeIngredients";a:0:{}s:17:"instructionsTitle";s:12:"Instructions";s:18:"recipeInstructions";a:0:{}s:18:"enableImageGallery";s:2:"no";s:18:"imageGalleryImages";a:0:{}s:18:"enableVideoGallery";s:2:"no";s:16:"videoGalleryVids";a:0:{}s:15:"recipeDelicious";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:7:"drImage";s:0:"";s:6:"drLink";s:0:"";}}s:11:"servingSize";s:0:"";s:8:"servings";s:0:"";s:8:"calories";s:0:"";s:15:"caloriesFromFat";s:0:"";s:8:"totalFat";s:0:"";s:12:"saturatedFat";s:0:"";s:8:"transFat";s:0:"";s:11:"cholesterol";s:0:"";s:6:"sodium";s:0:"";s:9:"potassium";s:0:"";s:17:"totalCarbohydrate";s:0:"";s:12:"dietaryFiber";s:0:"";s:6:"sugars";s:0:"";s:7:"protein";s:0:"";s:8:"vitaminA";s:0:"";s:8:"vitaminC";s:0:"";s:7:"calcium";s:0:"";s:4:"iron";s:0:"";s:8:"vitaminD";s:0:"";s:8:"vitaminE";s:0:"";s:8:"vitaminK";s:0:"";s:7:"thiamin";s:0:"";s:10:"riboflavin";s:0:"";s:6:"niacin";s:0:"";s:9:"vitaminB6";s:0:"";s:6:"folate";s:0:"";s:10:"vitaminB12";s:0:"";s:6:"biotin";s:0:"";s:15:"pantothenicAcid";s:0:"";s:10:"phosphorus";s:0:"";s:6:"iodine";s:0:"";s:9:"magnesium";s:0:"";s:4:"zinc";s:0:"";s:8:"selenium";s:0:"";s:6:"copper";s:0:"";s:9:"manganese";s:0:"";s:8:"chromium";s:0:"";s:10:"molybdenum";s:0:"";s:8:"chloride";s:0:"";s:11:"recipeNotes";s:0:"";s:9:"faqsTitle";s:26:"Frequently Asked Questions";s:10:"recipeFAQs";a:0:{}}

a:68:{s:14:"recipeSubtitle";s:57:"An Irresistibly Cheesy and Crunchy Grilled Cheese Delight";s:17:"recipeDescription";s:618:"

Indulge in the ultimate comfort food experience with our Crispy Cheddar Crunch Melt. This grilled cheese sandwich takes your taste buds on a journey of cheesy decadence, featuring layers of rich cheddar cheese and a delightful crunch from crispy fried onions. The marriage of gooey and crispy textures, all encased in buttery, golden-brown bread, makes this sandwich a mouthwatering treat that's perfect for satisfying your cravings. Whether you're looking for a quick and easy lunch or a comforting dinner option, this recipe is a flavorful twist on a classic favorite that's sure to become a household staple.

";s:14:"recipeKeywords";s:15:"Recipe Keywords";s:15:"difficultyLevel";s:8:"beginner";s:8:"prepTime";s:1:"5";s:12:"prepTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:8:"cookTime";s:1:"9";s:12:"cookTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:11:"cookingTemp";s:3:"149";s:15:"cookingTempUnit";s:1:"C";s:8:"restTime";s:0:"";s:12:"restTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:14:"recipeCalories";s:0:"";s:10:"bestSeason";s:9:"available";s:13:"estimatedCost";s:0:"";s:17:"estimatedCostCurr";s:0:"";s:12:"noOfServings";s:1:"1";s:15:"ingredientTitle";s:0:"";s:17:"recipeIngredients";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:12:"sectionTitle";s:0:"";s:11:"ingredients";a:3:{i:0;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:8:"2 slices";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:10:"ingredient";s:5:"bread";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:1;a:4:{s:8:"quantity";s:8:"2 slices";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:10:"ingredient";s:14:"Cheddar Cheese";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";}i:2;a:4:{s:8:"quantity";s:3:"1/4";s:4:"unit";s:3:"cup";s:10:"ingredient";s:19:"Crispy Fried Onions";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";}}}}s:17:"instructionsTitle";s:12:"Instructions";s:18:"recipeInstructions";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:12:"sectionTitle";s:0:"";s:11:"instruction";a:9:{i:0;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:50:"Preheat a skillet or griddle over medium-low heat.";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:1;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:46:"

Butter one side of each slice of bread.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:2;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:77:"

Place one slice of bread, buttered side down, onto the heated skillet.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:3;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:165:"

Layer the cheddar cheese slices onto the bread. You can use as much cheese as you like, but 2-4 slices should be enough to create a gooey and cheesy sandwich.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:4;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:62:"

Sprinkle the crispy fried onions evenly over the cheese

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:5;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:73:"

Press the sandwich gently with a spatula to help it stick together

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:6;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:173:"

Grill the sandwich for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until the bread turns golden brown and crispy, and the cheese has melted to your desired level of gooeyness.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:7;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:103:"

Once both sides are golden brown and the cheese is melted, remove the sandwich from the skillet.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:8;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:135:"

Let it cool for a minute or two to avoid burning your mouth, then slice it in half diagonally if desired, and serve immediately.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: This Crispy Cheddar Crunch Melt recipe is a student's dream – quick, budget-friendly, and the crispy cheddar topping is a game-changer! It's my new go-to comfort food.

a:68:{s:14:"recipeSubtitle";s:50:"A Quick and Delicious Microwave Pizza in 5 Minutes";s:17:"recipeDescription";s:387:"

Indulge in the convenience of a microwave-made pizza that's ready in just minutes. This 5-Ingredient Microwave Bread Pizza is a perfect solution for a speedy, satisfying snack or meal. Crispy bread, savory sauce, gooey cheese, and your favorite toppings come together to create a mini-pizza that's bursting with flavor. It's a must-try when you're craving pizza but short on time!

";s:14:"recipeKeywords";s:11:"bread pizza";s:15:"difficultyLevel";s:12:"intermediate";s:8:"prepTime";s:1:"5";s:12:"prepTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:8:"cookTime";s:0:"";s:12:"cookTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:11:"cookingTemp";s:1:"4";s:15:"cookingTempUnit";s:1:"C";s:8:"restTime";s:1:"1";s:12:"restTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:14:"recipeCalories";s:0:"";s:10:"bestSeason";s:6:"winter";s:13:"estimatedCost";s:0:"";s:17:"estimatedCostCurr";s:0:"";s:12:"noOfServings";s:0:"";s:15:"ingredientTitle";s:0:"";s:17:"recipeIngredients";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:12:"sectionTitle";s:0:"";s:11:"ingredients";a:7:{i:0;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:1:"2";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:10:"ingredient";s:5:"bread";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:1;a:5:{s:8:"quantity";s:3:"1/4";s:4:"unit";s:3:"cup";s:10:"ingredient";s:11:"pizza sauce";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";}i:2;a:4:{s:8:"quantity";s:3:"1/2";s:4:"unit";s:3:"cup";s:10:"ingredient";s:17:"mozzarella cheese";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";}i:3;a:4:{s:8:"quantity";s:3:"1/2";s:4:"unit";s:3:"tsp";s:10:"ingredient";s:13:"dried oregano";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";}i:4;a:4:{s:8:"quantity";s:0:"";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:10:"ingredient";s:9:"pepperoni";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";}i:5;a:4:{s:8:"quantity";s:0:"";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:10:"ingredient";s:19:"sliced bell peppers";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";}i:6;a:4:{s:8:"quantity";s:0:"";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:10:"ingredient";s:6:"olives";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";}}}}s:17:"instructionsTitle";s:12:"Instructions";s:18:"recipeInstructions";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:12:"sectionTitle";s:0:"";s:11:"instruction";a:8:{i:0;a:8:{s:16:"instructionTitle";s:0:"";s:11:"instruction";s:62:"

Place the two slices of bread on a microwave-safe plate

";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:1;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:130:"

Spread about 2 tablespoons of pizza sauce evenly on each slice of bread. Make sure to leave a small border around the edges

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:2;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:98:"

Sprinkle half of the shredded mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce on each slice of bread.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:3;a:6:{s:11:"instruction";s:125:"

Add your choice of pizza toppings. You can use pepperoni, sliced bell peppers, olives, or any other toppings you like.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:0:"";}i:4;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:104:"

Sprinkle a pinch of dried oregano or Italian seasoning over the top for extra flavor, if desired.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:5;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:257:"

Place the plate with the prepared bread pizzas in the microwave. Microwave on high for about 1-2 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Cooking time may vary depending on your microwave's wattage, so keep an eye on it to avoid overcooking.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:6;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:129:"

Carefully remove the plate from the microwave (it will be hot) and let the pizza cool for a minute or two before enjoying.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}i:7;a:5:{s:11:"instruction";s:152:"

Slice the bread pizzas into halves or quarters and serve. You can also add extra toppings like fresh basil or red pepper flakes for extra flavor.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";}}}}s:18:"enableImageGallery";a:1:{i:0;s:3:"yes";}s:18:"imageGalleryImages";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:7:"imageID";s:3:"768";s:10:"previewURL";s:74:"http://cookitup.great-site.net/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/th-1-150x150.jpg";}}s:18:"enableVideoGallery";s:2:"no";s:16:"videoGalleryVids";a:0:{}s:15:"recipeDelicious";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:7:"drImage";s:0:"";s:6:"drLink";s:0:"";}}s:11:"servingSize";s:0:"";s:8:"servings";s:0:"";s:8:"calories";s:0:"";s:15:"caloriesFromFat";s:0:"";s:8:"totalFat";s:0:"";s:12:"saturatedFat";s:0:"";s:8:"transFat";s:0:"";s:11:"cholesterol";s:0:"";s:6:"sodium";s:0:"";s:9:"potassium";s:0:"";s:17:"totalCarbohydrate";s:0:"";s:12:"dietaryFiber";s:0:"";s:6:"sugars";s:0:"";s:7:"protein";s:0:"";s:8:"vitaminA";s:0:"";s:8:"vitaminC";s:0:"";s:7:"calcium";s:0:"";s:4:"iron";s:0:"";s:8:"vitaminD";s:0:"";s:8:"vitaminE";s:0:"";s:8:"vitaminK";s:0:"";s:7:"thiamin";s:0:"";s:10:"riboflavin";s:0:"";s:6:"niacin";s:0:"";s:9:"vitaminB6";s:0:"";s:6:"folate";s:0:"";s:10:"vitaminB12";s:0:"";s:6:"biotin";s:0:"";s:15:"pantothenicAcid";s:0:"";s:10:"phosphorus";s:0:"";s:6:"iodine";s:0:"";s:9:"magnesium";s:0:"";s:4:"zinc";s:0:"";s:8:"selenium";s:0:"";s:6:"copper";s:0:"";s:9:"manganese";s:0:"";s:8:"chromium";s:0:"";s:10:"molybdenum";s:0:"";s:8:"chloride";s:0:"";s:11:"recipeNotes";s:0:"";s:9:"faqsTitle";s:26:"Frequently Asked Questions";s:10:"recipeFAQs";a:0:{}}

a:68:{s:14:"recipeSubtitle";s:59:"Homemade Mahewu: A Traditional African Fermented Milk Drink";s:17:"recipeDescription";s:415:"

Mahewu, a beloved traditional African fermented milk drink, offers a taste of authentic African cuisine. This easy homemade recipe guides you through the process of creating this refreshing and slightly tangy beverage. With maize meal as the main ingredient, Mahewu is a cultural staple that can be enjoyed on its own or used in various recipes. Try it for a delightful and nourishing taste of Africa at home

";s:14:"recipeKeywords";s:10:"Maize meal";s:15:"difficultyLevel";s:8:"advanced";s:8:"prepTime";s:2:"30";s:12:"prepTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:8:"cookTime";s:2:"14";s:12:"cookTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:11:"cookingTemp";s:0:"";s:15:"cookingTempUnit";s:1:"C";s:8:"restTime";s:0:"";s:12:"restTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:14:"recipeCalories";s:0:"";s:10:"bestSeason";s:6:"summer";s:13:"estimatedCost";s:0:"";s:17:"estimatedCostCurr";s:0:"";s:12:"noOfServings";s:0:"";s:15:"ingredientTitle";s:0:"";s:17:"recipeIngredients";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:12:"sectionTitle";s:0:"";s:11:"ingredients";a:3:{i:0;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:1:"1";s:4:"unit";s:3:"cup";s:10:"ingredient";s:10:"Maize meal";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:1;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:1:"5";s:4:"unit";s:3:"cup";s:10:"ingredient";s:5:"Water";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:2;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:1:"2";s:4:"unit";s:3:"tsp";s:10:"ingredient";s:12:"plain yogurt";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}}}}s:17:"instructionsTitle";s:12:"Instructions";s:18:"recipeInstructions";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:12:"sectionTitle";s:0:"";s:11:"instruction";a:9:{i:0;a:8:{s:16:"instructionTitle";s:25:"Mix Maize Meal and Water:";s:11:"instruction";s:135:"

In a large pot, combine the maize meal with a small amount of water to make a smooth, thick paste. Make sure there are no lumps.

";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:1;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:153:"

Gradually add the rest of the water to the pot while stirring to prevent lumps from forming. Continue stirring until the mixture is well combined.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:15:"Add More Water:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:2;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:288:"

Place the pot over medium heat and bring the mixture to a boil, stirring constantly to prevent it from sticking to the bottom of the pot. Once it reaches a boil, reduce the heat and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, continuing to stir. This cooking step helps to thicken the mixture.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:17:"Cook the Mixture:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:3;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:110:"

Allow the cooked mixture to cool down to lukewarm temperature. It should still be warm but not too hot.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:17:"Cool to Lukewarm:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:4;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:309:"

If you have plain yogurt or another cultured dairy product, you can use it as a starter culture to speed up the fermentation process and add a tangy flavor. Stir 1-2 tablespoons of yogurt into the lukewarm mixture. This step is optional, and traditional mahewu doesn't always include a starter culture.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:39:"Add the Starter Culture (if available):";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:5;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:139:"

Pour the lukewarm mixture into a clean, airtight container, leaving some room at the top to allow for expansion during fermentation.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:24:"Transfer to a Container:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:6;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:195:"

Seal the container and leave it at room temperature to ferment for at least 6-12 hours, or even longer if you prefer a tangier flavor. The longer it ferments, the more sour it will become.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:8:"Ferment:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:7;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:188:"

After the fermentation period, check the consistency of the mahewu. It should be thickened and slightly tangy. If it's not thick enough, you can let it ferment for a few more hours.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:22:"Check for Consistency:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:8;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:198:"

Once the mahewu is ready, refrigerate it to slow down the fermentation process and serve it cold. You can enjoy it as a refreshing beverage, or use it in recipes that call for fermented milk.

a:68:{s:14:"recipeSubtitle";s:24:"Classic Refreshing Salad";s:17:"recipeDescription";s:381:"

Experience the refreshing simplicity of our 'Garden Salad.' This classic medley of fresh lettuce, ripe tomatoes, crisp cucumbers, and a zesty vinaigrette dressing is a delightful combination of flavors and textures. It's a versatile, healthy dish that can serve as a side or a light, satisfying meal on its own. Elevate your dining experience with this easy-to-make classic.

the Vegetables:";s:11:"instruction";s:233:"
  • Wash and chop the lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
  • Slice the cucumber, cut the tomatoes into wedges or halve cherry tomatoes, and thinly slice the red onion. You can also add any other vegetables you like.
";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:1;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:264:"

In a small bowl, whisk together the extra-virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard (if using), minced garlic (if using), salt, and pepper. Adjust the seasoning to your taste. The mustard and garlic are optional but add extra flavor to the dressing.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:21:"Make the Vinaigrette:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:2;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:139:"

In a large salad bowl, combine the prepared lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, and any other vegetables you're using. Toss gently to mix.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:19:"Assemble the Salad:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:3;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:172:"

Drizzle the vinaigrette dressing over the salad. Start with a little dressing and add more as needed. Toss the salad to evenly coat the vegetables with the dressing.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:16:"Dress the Salad:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:4;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:170:"

Serve the salad immediately as a side dish or as a light, healthy meal on its own. You can also top it with croutons, grated cheese, or grilled chicken if desired.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Wow, this Garden Salad recipe is a lifesaver for students like me! It's super easy to put together, and I love how it's budget-friendly. I often struggle to find time and ingredients for fancy meals, but this salad is a game-changer. Plus, it's healthy and tastes great. I added some grilled chicken on top to make it a complete meal, and it was perfect. Definitely keeping this in my student recipe collection. Thanks for sharing.

a:68:{s:14:"recipeSubtitle";s:20:"One-Pan Comfort Food";s:17:"recipeDescription";s:352:"

Indulge in the comforting flavors of our 'Savory Chicken Rice Skillet.' This one-pan wonder features tender chunks of chicken, aromatic sautéed onions, and fluffy white rice bathed in rich chicken broth. It's a quick and satisfying meal, perfect for busy weeknights when you crave a hearty, savory dish that's as easy to make as it is to enjoy.

";s:14:"recipeKeywords";s:12:"rice chicken";s:15:"difficultyLevel";s:8:"advanced";s:8:"prepTime";s:2:"14";s:12:"prepTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:8:"cookTime";s:2:"20";s:12:"cookTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:11:"cookingTemp";s:0:"";s:15:"cookingTempUnit";s:1:"C";s:8:"restTime";s:0:"";s:12:"restTimeUnit";s:3:"min";s:14:"recipeCalories";s:0:"";s:10:"bestSeason";s:4:"fall";s:13:"estimatedCost";s:0:"";s:17:"estimatedCostCurr";s:0:"";s:12:"noOfServings";s:0:"";s:15:"ingredientTitle";s:0:"";s:17:"recipeIngredients";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:12:"sectionTitle";s:0:"";s:11:"ingredients";a:6:{i:0;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:1:"2";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:10:"ingredient";s:15:"chicken breasts";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:1;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:1:"1";s:4:"unit";s:3:"cup";s:10:"ingredient";s:4:"rice";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:2;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:1:"2";s:4:"unit";s:3:"cup";s:10:"ingredient";s:13:"chicken broth";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:3;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:1:"1";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:10:"ingredient";s:5:"onion";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:4;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:1:"2";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:10:"ingredient";s:13:"cloves garlic";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:5;a:6:{s:8:"quantity";s:1:"2";s:4:"unit";s:3:"tsp";s:10:"ingredient";s:9:"olive oil";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}}}}s:17:"instructionsTitle";s:12:"Instructions";s:18:"recipeInstructions";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:12:"sectionTitle";s:0:"";s:11:"instruction";a:6:{i:0;a:8:{s:16:"instructionTitle";s:19:"Sauté the Chicken:";s:11:"instruction";s:256:"

In a large skillet or pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the diced chicken and cook until it's no longer pink and has a golden-brown color, which should take about 5-7 minutes. Remove the cooked chicken from the pan and set it aside.

";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:1;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:154:"

In the same pan, add the finely chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until they become fragrant and the onions turn translucent.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:21:"Sauté the Aromatics:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:2;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:159:"

Pour the cup of long-grain white rice into the pan with the sautéed onions and garlic. Stir the rice to coat it with the flavors for about 1-2 minutes.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:18:"Add Rice and Stir:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:3;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:117:"

Return the cooked chicken to the pan with the rice. Pour in 2 cups of chicken broth. Stir everything together.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:26:"Combine Chicken and Broth:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:4;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:227:"

Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and has absorbed the liquid. Check and stir occasionally to prevent sticking.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:6:"Simmer";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:5;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:203:"

Once the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed, your super savory chicken and rice dish is ready. You can garnish it with chopped parsley, green onions, or grated Parmesan cheese, if you like.

Once the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed, your super savory chicken and rice dish is ready. You can garnish it with chopped parsley, green onions, or grated Parmesan cheese, if you like.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Wow, this recipe is a game-changer for a student like me! Quick and easy, and it tastes amazing. I love the combination of chicken and rice with that savory kick. Plus, it's a one-pan wonder, which means fewer dishes to wash—huge win for a busy student! Thanks for sharing this, it's definitely going into my regular rotation. 🍽️👏

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
a:68:{s:14:"recipeSubtitle";s:33:"A Nutritious African Comfort Dish";s:17:"recipeDescription";s:437:"

Indulge in the heartwarming simplicity of our 'Pumpkin Maize Meal Medley.' This traditional African comfort dish combines the earthy richness of maize meal with the sweet, tender notes of pumpkin. A nourishing and satisfying medley that's not only easy to make but also a delightful fusion of flavors and textures. Perfect as a standalone meal or a hearty side dish, it's a comforting taste of African cuisine that warms the soul.

Place the cubed pumpkin in a pot of boiling water and cook until it's soft and easily pierced with a fork. This usually takes about 10-15 minutes. Drain and set aside.

";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:1;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:387:"

While the pumpkin is cooking, prepare the maize meal by mixing it with water. In a separate pot, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Slowly add the maize meal to the boiling water, stirring continuously to prevent lumps. Reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the maize meal is cooked and has a thick, porridge-like consistency. Stir occasionally.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:23:"Prepare the Maize Meal:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:2;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:244:"

Once the maize meal is ready and the pumpkin is cooked, add the cooked pumpkin to the maize meal. Mix them together and continue to cook for an additional 5-10 minutes on low heat. The mixture should become a cohesive and flavorful dish.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:27:"Mix Pumpkin and Maize Meal:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:3;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:69:"

Season the sidvudvu with salt and pepper to taste, if desired.

";s:5:"image";s:0:"";s:13:"image_preview";s:0:"";s:8:"videoURL";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionNotes";s:0:"";s:16:"instructionTitle";s:7:"Season:";s:6:"chosen";s:0:"";s:8:"selected";s:0:"";}i:4;a:8:{s:11:"instruction";s:76:"

Serve the pumpkin and maize meal dish hot as a side or a main course.
